title: How to Create and Use Custom Icons

steps.headline: Go to Image, then Attributes.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Click View, then Zoom, then finally show grid.
Click View, then Zoom then Custom, and finally, put it at 800%!!!!!
Start painting.
steps.description: Grab a tool, draw away, and enjoy your amateur/moderate/professional work.

steps.description:
So when you go to 'Copy', it will automatically bring up a pop up that says "Save as". Ignore where it says "file type" . Just rename it if you want, and then at the end of the name put .ico{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8c\/Create-and-Use-Custom-Icons-Step-7.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-and-Use-Custom-Icons-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8c\/Create-and-Use-Custom-Icons-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Go to the folder or file you want a new icon for, go to Properties, go to Customize (or if it is already on the first selection then it should say "Change icon") and change the icon.
Save the *.ico version of the file on your desktop.

So when you go to 'Copy', it will automatically bring up a pop up that says "Save as".

Just rename it if you want, and then at the end of the name put .ico{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/8c\/Create-and-Use-Custom-Icons-Step-7.jpg\/v4-460px-Create-and-Use-Custom-Icons-Step-7.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8c\/Create-and-Use-Custom-Icons-Step-7.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Go to the folder or file you want a new icon for, go to Properties, go to Customize (or if it is already on the first selection then it should say "Change icon") and change the icon.
Save the *.ico version of the file on your desktop.
It makes for easier finding later.
